javadoc.text: * Base interface for multivariate distributions on the reals. * This is based largely on the RealDistribution interface, but cumulative * distribution functions are not required because they are often quite * difficult to compute for multivariate distributions.

* Returns the probability density function (PDF) of this distribution * evaluated at the specified point {@code x}. In general, the PDF is the * derivative of the cumulative distribution function. If the derivative * does not exist at {@code x}, then an appropriate replacement should be * returned, e.g. {@code Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY}, {@code Double.NaN}, or * the limit inferior or limit superior of the difference quotient.
javadoc.param: x Point at which the PDF is evaluated.
javadoc.return: the value of the probability density function at point {@code x}.

javadoc.text: * Reseeds the random generator used to generate samples.
javadoc.param: seed Seed with which to initialize the random number generator.

javadoc.text: * Gets the number of random variables of the distribution. * It is the size of the array returned by the {@link #sample() sample}method.
* Generates a random value vector sampled from this distribution.
* Generates a list of a random value vectors from the distribution.
javadoc.param: sampleSize the number of random vectors to generate.
javadoc.return: an array representing the random samples.
